page.title: 12WOMENS ORGANISATIONS
page.content:
Rural areas were the birthplace of {Womens Institutes}which provided a cetral focus for village life alongside the pub and the church.
The Women's Institute in particular grew in rural areas and although the square surveyed only has one, that at Milton Bryan, most of the srrounding villages have an active W.I.
The W.I. movement also spread to the towns and its interests and objectives moved away in the 80s from the traditinal area of the home and family to taking a more active role in matters of current interest.
Another body, the{Townswomen's Guilds} offered women a wide range of interesting activities, lectures and events, generally more urban based.
